elements.title: A Stormy Night (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first theatrical run of A Stormy Night by Ion Luca Caragiale (pictured), featuring a journalist nearly beaten up by the Civic Guard, saw Caragiale nearly beaten up by the Civic Guard?

elements.title: Hippolyte Triat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that pioneering bodybuilder Hippolyte Triat was kidnapped by vagabonds at the age of six and sold to a troupe of Italian acrobats?

elements.title: Benin Altar Tusks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nigeria seeks the return of the Benin Altar Tusks, ivory artefacts taken by the British in 1897 and dispersed in Europe?

elements.title: Cold Cathode Gauge Experiment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Cold Cathode Gauge Experiment could detect gases leaking from an astronaut's life support systems on the Moon's surface?

elements.title: Titina Silá (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the national women's day of Guinea-Bissau commemorates the death of Titina Silá, who was killed on this day during the nation's war of independence?

elements.title: Adly Mansour Transportation Hub (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Adly Mansour Transportation Hub was selected as the best rail project of 2022 by Engineering News-Record?

elements.title: Tucker Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tucker Hall and Ewell Hall sit on either side of the Sunken Garden on the College of William & Mary's campus?

elements.title: Nietzsche, se créer liberté (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the comic book Nietzsche, se créer liberté tries to express Friedrich Nietzsche's personality visually?
